title: Zimbabwe: Proposed Mining Law Amendments Before Cabinet
text:
THE proposed Mines and Minerals Bill, which aims to make minerals exploration more transparent and sustainable, is now before Cabinet for debate, the Financial Gazette's Companies & Companies has established. The development was revealed by Mines and Mining Development deputy Minister, Fred Moyo last week. "The Attorney General's office legal drafting department has sent the proposed Bill to Cabinet for debate, "said Moyo. The bill includes proposals to transform the Minerals Marketing Corporation of Zimbabwe into a fully-fledged mineral exploration corporation. It also discourages speculative activities in the mining sector as well as facilitating economic empowerment of the country's previously disadvantaged black majority. The amendment are also expected to incorporate a "use it or lose it" policy, which is aimed at compelling claim holders to utilise their claims or risk having them repossessed. Therefore, the proposed amendments would enable government to repossess under-utilised mining claims held for speculation purposes. Amendments of the Mines and Minerals Act have been in the pipeline for more than 10 years and there are calls that government should expedite the proposed amendments so that prospective investors are clear about the operating environment.
